title: Crypto Treasury Companies: The Next Big Investment or a Meme-Stock Trap?
description: In 2020, Michael Saylor’s Strategy (NASDAQ:MSTR) (formerly MicroStrategy) pioneered the crypto treasury company model by acquiring 21,454 Bitcoin (CRYPTO:BTC) for $250 million, sparking a corporate trend of holding digital assets as reserve capital.  Strategy stock has soared over 2,280% in five years, outpacing Bitcoin itself, inspiring imitators like Metaplanet, which has amassed 16,352 BTC. title: Nasdaq Ramps Up Scrutiny on Crypto Buys to Prevent Stock Inflation
description: Nasdaq is ramping up scrutiny of listed companies aggressively buying cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin to fund holdings, aiming to prevent artificial stock price inflation without core business improvements. This includes delaying approvals and demanding disclosures, potentially tempering crypto enthusiasm and promoting sustainable integration.

title: Why Monero (XMR) is 2025’s Hottest Crypto for Privacy Seekers
description: Monero has been unique since its release in 2014 by focusing on the privacy of its users first. title: Trump-backed bitcoin company begins trading on Nasdaq
description: A bitcoin treasury and mining company linked to the Trump family has begun trading on the Nasdaq stock market. American Bitcoin's listing follows a merger with Gryphon Digital Mining. The company is backed by Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump. Eric Trump, a co-founder, calls the Nasdaq debut a historic milestone for bitcoin in U.S. capital markets. Public companies accumulating bitcoin as a corporate treasury has become a popular trend. American Bitcoin plans to use self-mining operations and opportunistic bitcoin purchases to stand out.
